thread.title: Every Movie & TV Show Steven Soderbergh Watched in 2016

author: Emily Buder
title: Every Movie & TV Show Steven Soderbergh Watched in 2016

organizations.name: every movie & tv show steven soderbergh watched

text:
Every Movie & TV Show Steven Soderbergh Watched in 2016 From Black Mirror to Apocalypse Now , Steven Soderbergh had quite the dystopian year in entertainment. 
No, Steven Soderbergh did not retire this year. Instead, the indefatigable director-writer-cinematographer managed to perform all three roles on two new films ( Mosaic and Logan Lucky ), begin producing Ocean's Eight , and, apparently, watch hundreds of movies and television shows—when he wasn't reading a book or a play. 
That's right—the annual list of Soderbergh entertainment consumption is out. This year's edition was quite revealing; he quit Westworld and Stranger Things after the first episodes, opting instead for Black Mirror and Mr. Robot binges. (With Panic Room, Children of Men , Seven , and Apocalypse Now also on the list, we noticed a bit of an apocalyptic/dystopian throughline.) 
Soderbergh gets an "A" for approachability for his populist choices, with a mix of highfalutin titles thrown in. They range from Karl Ove Knausgaard's My Struggle: Book Five to the director's unabashed obsession with the Olympics. Even better, he went out with a bang: on Christmas Day, Soderbergh enjoyed a double feature of Rogue One and The Godfather, Part II . Content Type Key
